FIORINI is out for her morning run. She is in her 30's, s wearing shorts, a tee shirt, an MP3 player. Up the street, a group of men leave a mosque. Sandals, wh robes, beards, turbans. The OLD MAN looks at her i He crosses the street, away from her. Clicks of camera shutters. He and the men around him are in a series of photographs.

FIORINI comes through the door, panting. In the room are cameras by the window. A young black man, DEEJAY JACKSON,  cell phone. goes through the photographs on a computer. FIORINI towel 2. MICHAEL LEONARD, same age as FIORINI but less senior,

The old guy, white turban, black scarf around it. You got him? Good.

A picture of the OLD MAN is pinned to a wall of boards co with a hundred pictures, names, and lines drawn between t FIORINI and her two agents are in a crime room, a bunch o photographs on the table. Through a glass wall is the mai office,

Dam.

Fitna.

Fitna. Means ‘a dangerous woman’. We make men forget their families, forget Allah. They avoid us, we're dangerous, and if you have any pictures of my ass there, believe me that will be true. new young agent, enters, with a stack of papers.

Agent Phillips, if we have a meeting at ten, don’t turn up at half past.

Well. .no. FIORINI sighs.

Mike, we get wider and wider, but we don’t get deeper. (she turns to the board) A mosque with a crazy Imam and a bunch of militant Muslims. They say nasty things, nasty friends in Bakistan, ut what evidence do we have?
We have them receiving large amounts of money from suspect organizations...
To rebuild the mosque.
Or material support for a terrorist conspiracy.
To do what, about what? We have nothing that would stand up.
We could get them on jaywalking. And there’s a case of indecent display... e points to a picture of the men, with FIORINI behind the ben ing over in her shorts.

NOT funny... IN THE MAIN OFFICE, VINCENT sits at his desk. An older gu looking. Through the internal windows to the crime room, see FIORINI, wrapping up. He looks at her a little longer should. Near him are Agents TUCKER and UNSWORTH. A TV on is showing pictures of a man, and three basement rooms.
--.a murder followed by a kidnapping of a group of children. The alert began in Cincinnati, and is now nationwide, and urgent. Do you (MORE )
TV NEWS ANNOUNCER,CNN (cont'd) recognize this man, or any of these places?...

Something going on. You seen this? FIORINI comes out of the crime room, and leans on VINCENT
Not going so well?
Three months, a thousand contacts, a mass of evidence, all about nothing. There’s a big chunk of this missing. I look at that board, I think maybe it’s right there and I just can’t see it.
Yeah. Scary.
I’m not scared, Vince, just concerned.
You wanted to lead an investigation.
I really thought we might have something here... VINCENT gazes at her.
So did I. FIORINI gives him a look.
Sorry.
Is she hitting on you again?
What’s the matter, jealous?
Last time anyone hit on him was 1978. VINCENT laughs. TUCKER flicks the TV remote. The same new
Hey...this guy’s on every channel.
Check out shopping channel, 56.  The Shopping Channel comes up.
There you gor real American TV, none of this public service crap.
As you know we don' "break for news, but we like to help law enforcement, we want to show you some pictures... The same pictures. The man. The basements. The Agents wat
First time I seen that...
The man has been named as William Younger, aged 38. If you have seen this man or have any information...
Oh my God... She runs INTO THE CRIME ROOM, and points to a face on the edge of the board.
Who’s covering this guy? Younger?
He’s one of mine.
Well I think he got away from you. She points at the TV, visible through the glass wall in t room, showing the face of William YOUNGER. VINCENT comes
Get his file. Where is that?
Cincinnati.
Get me the Field Office there, right now. Jesus Christ, the TV has this before we do? Phillips? JACKSON is on the phone, PHILLIPS fumbles with the file.

William Younger, only seen him twice at_the mosque. I got his military file, nothing in it. No current address, no record, no history of extremism. His Mother is a Muslim, family connection to Aliah Mustafa. This one.
Why isn’t that on the board?
She’s connected to everybody.
Ask Mister Baines to step in here.
I think he’s coming... JACKSON is looking through the glass wall behind them. Me suits hurry into the main office and take up position nea doors. Supervisor BAINES leads another man into the crime
Sir, we just...

This is Mister Saunders, for those of you who don’t know, he’s our Deputy Director. This is Agent Fiorini. The team are astonished. JACKSON puts down the phone. SAU a big man of 50, grim, and serious. He gives FIORINI a lo
Your operation?
Yes Sir. She looks to BAINES for a lead. Nothing. SAUNDERS sees th of FIORINI’s ass.
We weren’t expecting your visit, Sir. SAUNDERS studies the board.
These are your suspects?
Yes Sir.
We need to bring them in. All of them, their families, their relations, their business associates, their friends, every 9° contact you have in every single fil
That would take hundreds of agents.
You have thousands. Anything you want, anything you need, you got it. Every (MORE )
SAUNDERS (cont'd) agent in the bureau will be available. And every cop on the street. SAUNDERS looks at the TV, showing pictures of YOUNGER and basement rooms.
We need him, and we need to find those places.
That’s a murder kidnap, Sir.

Don’t believe what you see on TV. These gentlemen are here to ensure security. Every .¢ call you make will now be monitored le’1l contact your families, tell them you’1l not be home for a while. Other Suits start to bring in boxes of files into the Mai

You will be getting a few thousand new files, these are paper files, not computerized, not even on our system. You need to cover them, fast. The slightest relevance to your investigation and we bring them in.
Sir, you have to tell us what this is about
No I don’t. You should know that FBI is no longer the lead ggency in this investigation. You will be briefed in due course. The agents are stunned.
You'd better make a start. We may not have much time...

A suburban home outside Washington. A security gate at th a long drive, with walls surrounding the house and garden Inside, in the kitchen, RINA makes breakfast, while the T Through open glass doors, out in the garden, a man is lyi back, playing with his children. The breaking news right now is a_case that involves the murder of a police officer, and the abduction of a number of children. Mailman. She cycles through six different screens. Each one shows security camera image of every side of the house, the gar back to the front gate - where she sees the mailman get o

You check out the mailman when I'm not here?
Every day. H smiles, and leans on the counter. RINA turns the TV bac

Or maybe you know one of these places? They could be basement areas in your building, a workshop or garage... H sees a large fly land on the wall. He flicks it with a but misses. The fly lands on the kitchen counter. Instant SMASHES down on it. RINA wipes her hand, and the counter, continues preparing food. H turns back to the TV.
The main office and the crime room are now packed with ag Lots of action, and more files arriving all the time. LEO desk is covered with files.
That’s a no, these are yes. An Agent picks up a stack of files. LEONARD calls after h

People! Every file goes to Fiorini’s team for final action. You reject nothing until they say so. TUCKER and UNSWORTH enter the crime room, heading for FIO the board. PHILLIPS makes circles around various faces.
Okay, this one, the family is here, but he’s in Pakistan.
Bring in the family. And this guy’s important, make a call.
Fiorini, a word.
If it’s quick.
Last year we had an assignment. A covert operation went wrong. They wanted us to wipe their asses.

There was this guy, Henry Roberts. They wanted him, we couldn’t find him. But here he is, address, everything. He gives FIORINI a file, she looks at it quickly. Photogr few nearly gmety pages with some large print - “Refer to a. ie Departmen’ s before any further action”. Also an envelope sealed, and stamped “RESTRICTED”.
Do we have number forty-three, Aliah Mustafa?
I sent three teams out, nothing yet. (to TUCKER _and_ UNSWORTH) Guys, I have fifty files on my desk, where is this from?
O.G.A. Other Government Agencies.
What was this case about?
We never knew. FIORINI puts the file down and talks to BAINES as he pass  10.
Sir, we still don’t have the file on Younger.
Restricted access, not available yet.
We have a profiling team, they have nothing to work on. Sir, when do we find out what this is...
Soon. BAINES moves on.
The file says refer to Departmental...
Listen, I don’t have time, you go pick him up, tell me about it later. FIORINI moves on. The agents look at each other, unhappy. INT. H’'S HOME, NEAR BALTIMORE - DAY
RINA is ironing clothes in the kitchen. In the living roo reading to PETER and KATIE. So Mummy Bear and Daddy Bear and Baby Bear all fell fast asleep. You think it’s true?
Yes.
No! The red light on the wall flashes. RINA clicks the remote doesn’t like what she sees. She exchanges a look with H.

You’d better check, see if they’re sleeping. Go get the bears, go on. H is She The kids run. H walks into the front room, and opens a cu Inside is a panel of six video monitors. We found them. We got them!
Oh, that’s great, go show Mummy, quick, quic  11. The kids run from the room. H dials the cell phone. The m the front gate. The doorbell rings in the house. H calls

A garbage heap of an office. CHARLIE THOMAS is 50, and eq disheveled, gray hair, bad teeth. He shouts down a phone.
I don't care, you keep them secure, you do nothing until I tell you. You understand? Another telephone starts ringing. CHARLIE checks the call

I got to go, call me if you need to, and you do NOT need to... He puts down one phone. He takes a breath, then answers t INTERCUT WITH H’s HOUSE, as H looks at _the monitor. The stand at the gate, and ring the doorbell again.
H, I was going to talk to you...
Charlie, do I have a problem? CHARLIE . No, but we may need to call you in...
I got two guys outside my gate, are they ours?
What? No. On the monitor, there’s only one man at the front gate. H to the monitor of the side wall, and sees the other man w round to the back of the house.
You sure Charlie, one hundred percent?
Of course I am. There’s no-one on your case.
Jesus. I deal with this, then you relocate us immediately.
H, hold on...  12. This is m family, goddam it! You send some people NOW!
We'll get there, you have priority...
You said that last time, Charlie. H rings off.

H? H! Crap. INT. H’'S HOME, NEAR WASHINGTON - DAY H_ sees the man at the front gate talk into a cell phone. flicks the monitor, and sees the man at the back of the h also talking into his phone. Material support for terrorism, it’s all we can hold them on... Of course you read their rights, what kind of question is that? I got to go. (she clicks on her cell phone) Fiorini.

Listen to me, please, I do not want information. One file was sent to_you in error. Name of Henry Roberts. It was a mistake. He is an extremely dangerous man...hello?
Wait.

This is the remote for my garage door. I am now going to open it.

You’re safe to approach, get a medic! Some agents run towards the garage, other run for the fro

H sits alone, angry. VINCENT enters with FIORINI, holding
I am Agent Fiorini, this is Agent Vincent...
Did you send those guys? Are you responsible for this?
Sir, I think you may be responsible for shooting an FBI Agent. You are Henry Roberts?
Who gave you a file on me?
Is that your name?
No. It’s a false identity.
Okay. You’ve been read your rights...
My guy is coming.
You haven’t made a call. No-one knows you're here. H says nothing. FIORINI slides a picture of YOUNGER towar

Yes. FIORINI just nods, her smile giving nothing away.

Is this your screw-up? FIORINI . You have a first name you can give me? A real one? H sighs and shakes his head. Okay, let's Slay the game, all smiles, make nice to me, you know how it goes. You can call me H. What's your first name, Fiorini?
Felicity.
Oh that’s so cute, now we’re such good friends, right? VINCENT ; Attempted murder is not a joke.
Your agents came to my home, my children were there. If I wanted to kill them, I could have. (to FIORINI) You have made a serious mistake.
The Agent you shot, he identified himself as FBI?
I didn’t get a chance to check him.
So you did shoot him?
Oh, Felicity, you are so good at this.
He could have died. You gave him coagulant to stop the bleeding, morphine for the pain.
I’m a Saint. 17.  18.
You have those things just lying around the house?
Yes.
Well thank you, H, you did the right thing. You said you recognized him? She points casually to the picture on the desk.
Yes. From the TV. The door opens. BAINES walks in, with CHARLIE and EVE ZAC elegant woman of 45. FIORINI and VINCENT are confused.
Agent Fiorini, we have received instructions. This interview is suspended.
You bastard, I RELY ON YOU. You Sir, what do vou mean? Wh told me, one hundred per cent, these people? We can’t jus those were not our guys.
Your name got on some NSA list, We have to surrender the CIA gave it to FBI, no-one told suspect. me.
What the hell is this?
There’s been a foul-up. It seems this “gentleman” is on our side. He’s going to be working the same investigation. I am what? ZACHARY (re BAINES ) I can’t believe you let this happen.
You sent us his file, don't blame FBI.
Did you check your leads against the witness protection program, like the priority” list with all the red tags saying "Do not touch"?
He’s in witness protection? We didn’t have time for that!  19.
We put him there so you would leave him alone.
Hi, we talked. I’m Charlie... You can all_ qo fuck vourse Last year H had a contract out I told you I would never w on him. with you people again.
Two quvs from Chechnya, we got This is never, now is neve to them first. are coming with us.
He’s a target, he thought your When you've finished with guys were killers... you can be sure we won’t have.

Wait a minute, he dam near killed one of our agents...
We have other priorities.
You what!
Let it go, Fiorini.
Charlie, put him in the car, now. ZACHARY leaves. CHARLIE goes to the door and holds it ope
Fiorini, this investigation is being transferred to another facility.
That’s crazy, we’re set up right here!
We have orders. I expect leadership from you, not resistance. FIORINI swallows it. H sighs and gets up.
Looks like we’re both getting screwed. H heads for the door, but FIORINI gets in his face.
Who are you?  20.
Best not to ask. CHARLIE and H leave. BAINES is left with the two agents.
I’ll prepare my team for transfer,Sir.

Two black SUV’s on the road. Inside them are FIORINI and LEONARD, JACKSON, PHILLIPS. Also SUTTON, a young security officer, in dark suit, shades, and earphones. The SUV’s steer into a gap in a concrete wall. Gates clos them. Uniformed personnel and dogs scan the vehicles. The SUV's drives into a walled compound, a former militar Some of the buildings are derelict and boarded up. They p outside a large building.

Need to know, you don’t. This way.
In the new FBI room, the old suspect boards are being set suits and military personnel. On the walls are the images YOUNGER, and the three different basement rooms. The AGEN
This is where you work. At this point I will take your firearms from you.
You’re not taking my weapon. Who the hell are you?
Listen, lady, just hand over the gun.
You call me “Agent”. And you try taking my weapon, I will shove it right up your ass.
Let her keep the dam thing. GENERAL GUNTER is there, a bull of a man. VANDERBIDEN is him, a civilian, pompous and overweight. SAUNDERS is behi
Yes Sir. This is General Gunter, Commander, Sitcon.
You’re Fiorini?
Agent Fiorini. He looks at her. A woman.
FBI is here to assist with investigative duties under my command.
No Sir, Posse Comitatus. Unless the President has invoked Martial Law, the military has no jurisdiction over civilian authority.
Defence Authorization Act 2007. You may have missed the small print. Tell her, Mister Saunders. Saunders looks grim.
President has the authority to use the armed forces in order to suppress, in any State, any insurrection, unlawful combination or conspiracy.
Can we get on with this? VANDERBIDEN gives SUTTON a tape, which he puts in a VCR. and H enter the room. The agents are horrified.
Hello Felicity. Isn’t this fun?
Welcome. This is the Situation Control Center. My name is Vanderbiden, I’m with the Department of Homeland Security. Two days ago we received.
Play the fucking tape. The tape begins. FIORINI stares at H, who smiles, 21.
and points at the screen. FIORINI hears the voice and turns to watch. On the tape, the image of YOUNGER appears. He is in what like a basement room, standing in front of a large device  22.

In the name of Allah the merciful, and his prophet Mohammed, 1 gace be upon him. My name is Yusuf Atta Mohammed. My former name is William Arthur Younger. All the rest you will learn from your files. This is location one.
We took a screen capture of all the locations, cleaned them up, took him out of it. And took that thing out.
Some of you will recognize this. It is a bomb. FIORINI gasps. The location and sound changes on the tape

This is location two. All the locations are in urban areas. I have demands which will be met by you, or these bombs will explode. TI will give you these demands at a later date. The location and sound change again.
This is location three. All three devices are identical. All three will explode in seven days, on Friday the 21st at lpm. And all three of these devices... are nuclear bombs.
Oh my God...
Your experts will want evidence, of course, so I will now describe the technical aspects of each device. YOUNGER begins to go through the details. SUTTON mutes th

We'll spare you the details. After 9-11, iP there’s a one per cent chance, the threat is considered real. This one is 99 per cent. He’s one of us. A military scientist, specialist in field nuclear weapons. Served in Iraq with Special Forces to check out nukes. A grade ‘A’ guy, top honors, totally dedicated.
His father is American. Worked at the embassy in Pakistan, met a woman there, became a Moslem so he could marry her, forced to leave the Diplomatic Corps. They had a son in (MORE)

SAUNDERS (cont'd) Pakistan, then moved back here, the son was granted citizenship.. And the boy just got the normal background check. After all it would be so wrong for anyone to suggest that Islamic terrorists have one thing in common - they're all Islamic. H laughs at himself. The others look at him with disgust.
This is not funny.
He’s made no demands, no further contact.
Where could he get nuclear material?
Three years ago he was on a team checking nuclear facilities in Russia.
Oh, great choice.
Since then, some material has gone missing The Russians can’t trace about fifteen, eighteen pounds, they can’t be accurate. Around five pounds on each bomb. Three big cities.
Sir, do we have any direct evidence that he’s for real? SAUNDERS turns to GUNTER, who sighs, and nods.
The Iranians paid him twenty million to get nuclear material out of Russia and bring it back to them. They \se set the whole thing up. Then they lo track of him, and the money.
How do we know this?
They told us. One of their Generals was a little concerned. We might think they were responsible for what Younger does with the stuff. Nice excuse to bomb the crap out of them.
What does he want? Why did he do it?  24.
Jesus, the question is not “why he did it”,but “where are the fucking bombs”?
You think you can answer one without the other?

His wife is a liberal type, environmental nut. She wanted a divorce, he didn’t. He tried to take their two kids back to his Mother in Pakistan. The court stopped him, gave custody to the wife. Maybe that turned him, we don’t know. At some point he became a fundamentalist.
He wants to nuke us because we took his kids?
You mess with my family, I’d feel the same way.
I have copies of his restricted file. VANDERBIDEN hands out files. FIORINI grabs hers and scans
Everything I need in here?
Sure.
You’1l inform me of any developments?
Yup.
Not much point if you don't.
We need you to get back to work. But you even whisper the word nuclear, and you'll be withdrawn immediately. Understood? FIORINI looks up from the file, angry.
You knew all this and you didn’t tell us? We could have cracked this before it even happened.  25.
Intelligence couldn't put the pieces together.
But that’s exactly what we do!
So how come our people found his home.
Maybe because they had the file, Sir.
I sent Agent Vincent down there. We have forensics working on it now. You better take a look.
You too.
Will someone please tell me who this person is?
Just do your job, Fiorini. FIORINI looks at H. H smiles back.

FIORINI, H and CHARLIE go through the house with VINCENT. lifeless, bare. Family photos, parents, a blonde wife wit kids, military buddies in fatigues. An American flag on t ERT technicians in plastic suits are still working. H see

Nothing out of place. Everything as it should be. The female cousin, Aliah Mustafa. No trace of her?
No other prints, no fibers, no hair. Just him.
That’s impossible.
Someone cleaned it real good. CHARLIE and H move on. FIORINI speaks quietly to VINCENT.
Did Military Intelligence go through this place before we did?  26.
I think we can assume that.
What the fuck is going on? And you, why the hell didn’t you tell me you'd been sent here?
They told me not to. FIORINI shakes her head in disbelief.
Are they trying to replace me with someone else - like you?
